venue.name: Rabb Auditorium at Boston Public Library in Copley Square

item.description:
SLAM OF ALL SLAMMERS! THE BIG MOUTH OFF - the final contest in massmouth ‘s 2009 – 2010 series of story slams. 6PM sharp on APRIL 20th 2010 at Rabb Hall, Copley, Boston Public Library, Boston MA

Personal stories are a “gift of experience” without the wear and tear of having to go through it- for the past 6 months massmouth has hosted slams on the following themes: scared to death, dining disasters, it’s my job, so embarrassing, it’s relative, errors of eros, love and lies, outrageous, in like a lion. In each slam ten contestants told their real life stories and two winners became finalists.

COME SEE THE WINNERS OF THE BOSTON AND CAMBRIDGE STORY SLAMS– PLUS ONE PEOPLE’S CHOICE COMPETE FOR THE GRAND PRIZE – A WEEK AT A MEDEIVAL TUSCAN TOWNHOUSE, and other prizes for 3 winners chosen by celebrity judges. In addition there will be 1 audience choice winner.

At 700 Boylston Street, Boston, at the Copley T stop - in front of the Boston Public Library - on the site of the Boston Marathon finish line, on April 20th at 6 pm sharp. Come to a virtual marathon of storytelling! massmouth presents have stories that highlight the human experience in all its darkness and light! Seasoned and fledgling storytellers strut their stuff, share their experiences and reveal their insights in this epic competition. 20 storytellers of all levels, plus one surprise Peoples Choice. Any one of them can win the grand prize – it all comes down to the winning story. Celebrity judges, guest musicians and improv games!

So… if you ran the Boston marathon and need restoration, come recharge with us! If you didn’t run April 19th and want a different kind of marathon, come experience massmouth‘s story marathon!

group.name: CLOSING DOWN THIS MEETUP GROUP: massmouth storytellers

item.name: The Big Mouthoff or - grand finale of the slam season
